column4: anyone know a cmd i can type into terminal to get everyone that has recently logged into my machine - every single user?
and also to see what users there are on my system?
/var/log/auth.log is the log of authenticated sessions
take a look at /var/log/auth.log.. whatever editor you prefer, or `less`
so that helped, but it only goes back to february 4
is there a farther back log?
logrotate compresses your logs and puts them in archive mode
to read the ones with .gz extension, do `gunzip <log>`
